basics.name: Justin Honda
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Science with an emphasis in bioinformatics in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaii. I hope to graduate in Spring 2021 then matriculate into the M.S program.

highlights: Learned required technical skills to operate optical machinery for diagnostic, clinical, and analytical purposes
Worked on the front-end administrative operations of patient care: learned medical system user interface
Shadowed a board-certified ophthalmologist and witnessed hands on patient care and diagnosis
Observed numerous optical surgeries including cataract, pterygium excision, and corneal transplants
Reviewed case and clinical research studies under the supervision of a board-certified Ophthalmologist

volunteer.summary: Taught 5th grade students algebra 1, oversaw project SPF (see projects for more details), helped to raise funds for a shade structure
highlights: Taught basic algebra skills to elementary school students
Taught and facilitated the use of CAD to design and build 3D printed shade structure models
Facilitated the raising of funds needed to build a permanent structure implemented into an East Oahu elementary school campus through various fundraisers
Raised communal awareness of skin cancer and the necessity of SPF (sun protection) via various speaking events/fundraising events/festivals
Played an early role in the administrative processes of incorporation: helped fill out incorporation and tax documentation

awards.title: Speaker
awards.summary: Presented a clinical study of post-operative necrotizing scleritis. (See projects for more information)
